text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

text.#text:
The chemical sector of the United States
			 represents a target that terrorists could exploit to cause consequences,
			 including death, injury, or serious adverse effects to human health, the
			 environment, critical infrastructure, public health, homeland security,
			 national security, and the national economy.

Chemical facilities that pose such
			 potential consequences and that are vulnerable to terrorist attacks must be
			 protected.

has

text.#text: The

restricting the area perimeter of the

securing site assets;

screening and controlling access to the

				facility terrorist incident or actions having serious negative consequences for
				the population surrounding the covered chemical facility; and

measures implementing a regularly updated

				measures;

security personnel;
detection systems;

hardened or reduced value targets;
